## PHQ-9 vs PAS

Harmony is an innovative, AI-powered software opens up more profound, nuanced opportunities for psychologists and researchers developing and administering questionnaires for their studies. One such potential comparison that can be made through Harmony is between the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9) and the Pandemic Anxiety Scale (PAS). PHQ-9 vs PAS provides a unique opportunity to examine the correlation between mental health and the effects of the global pandemic, especially with the tools offered by Harmony.





{{< image src="images/gad7-becks.jpg" alt="dog" title="dog" >}}

{{< card heading="Try Harmony" copy="Compare PHQ-9 and PAS " url="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app" >}}

{{< youtube cEZppTBj1NI >}}




PHQ-9 evaluates nine criteria related to depression, while the 12-item PAS focuses on virus-related stress, anxiety, and potential shifts in home and school attitudes during the lockdown.

## Compare the items in PHQ-9 and PAS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import PHQ-9 and PAS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just PHQ-9 into Harmony</a> - compare PHQ-9 with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just PAS into Harmony</a> - compare PAS with other instruments


Harmony streamlines the often tiresome task of instrument harmonisation, permitting psychologists to delve deeper into the impact of the ongoing mental health crisis. Harmony does not merely provide a platform for comparing instruments like PHQ-9 vs PAS, but it also significantly simplifies the process of data analysis in multiple languages. By offering a percentage match metric for each item in the two instruments, Harmony ensures a coherent and harmonised understanding of collected data.
